channel.title: Hugo Relearn Documentation on TSSOC
channel.description: Recent content in Hugo Relearn Documentation on TSSOC

item.title: Basics
item.description: Discover what this Hugo theme is all about and the core-concepts behind it. What's New Requirements Installation Configuration Customization Stylesheet generator History

item.title: Content
item.description: Find out how to create and organize your content quickly and intuitively. Pages organization Archetypes Markdown syntax Code highlighting Menu extra shortcuts Multilingual and i18n Tags

item.title: Shortcodes
item.description: Hugo uses Markdown for its simple content format. However, there are a lot of things that Markdown doesnâ€™t support well. You could use pure HTML to expand possibilities. But this happens to be a bad idea. Everyone uses Markdown because it’s pure and simple to read even non-rendered. You should avoid HTML to keep it as simple as possible. To avoid this limitations, Hugo created shortcodes. A shortcode is a simple snippet inside a page.
